you will have to upgrade to intrepid first afaik
Thanks - Was afraid of that being the case - kinda figured that but wanted to make sure.
Probably just start over with a new bigger Hard Drive anyways - be best in long run.......
Thanks
the desktop iso has the option for custom partitioning
On last 2 installs have just did the easy no brainner installs
then pick manual when it comes to disk partitioning
Ok - but not sure how big to make swap, ext4, etc etc.
ext4 is not advised right now, i would make your swap double the size of your ram
Running 4gigs - that would be quite the swap wouldn't it?
do you anticipate using 4Gb of ram in your ubuntu system?
what is the ubuntu boot going to be doing?
if its standard web browsing and chat then you can get way with a very small or no swap, for system intensive stuff having a larger swap will help
there is no black and white answer
Mostly downloading movies, files, burning CD's - I do like to use it for everything - listening to sounds - surf'n the web etc etc you name it. Burn some DVD's too.....
1Gb will do yu fine then
you wont hit 4gb ever but its nice to have a little one, set your swappiness to 1 or 2 and you'll be fine
cool - Not sure how my last "no brainner" install did it but ended up using 9gigs for my swap - way way to much....
yep, 2 x ram
But that sounds way over kill correct?
depends, if you are performing full 3d rendering then i'd have that much swap, it just covers all areas if it goes OTT
remember, ubuntu is trying to be a 1 glove fits all
